    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Client
    A client in the game.
    Connection
    A Connection is the way the server and clients signal to each other that they are still active.
    Connection.ConnectionMonitor
    A PublisherService that monitors a connection.
    CPU
    A CPU-controlled client.
    DirectoryMonitor
    Monitors changes in a directory.
    FileMonitor
    Monitors changes in a file.
    GameServer
    An individual game's server.
    Main
    A multiplayer tic-tac-toe game.
    MainServer
    The game system's main server.
    Monitor<T>
    An abstract PublisherService that periodically polls something and calls the callbacks with the result if there is an update.
    Monitor.When
    Wrapper class for all monitors used in this program, with the purpose to make the code more readable.
    Option
    Utility class for handling user options in the terminal.
    Player
    A human-controlled client.
    Protocol
    Utility class for operations required to run the multiplayer system.
    Publisher<T>
    The Subject in the observer design pattern, but with a cooler name.
    PublisherService<T>
    An abstract implementation of Publisher and Service.
    Reader
    Class for reading user inputs from the terminal.
    Reader.Key
    Keys used in this program.
    Scheduler
    Utility class for service-related operations.
    Server
    The program to start/stop the server.
    Service
    Something that runs in another thread.
    Subscriber<T>
    The Observer in the observer design pattern, but with a cooler name.
    TicTacToe
    A extended Tic Tac Toe game, with a 15x15 board and you connect 5 dots in a row to win.
    TicTacToe.Coordinate
    Represents a coordinate on the game board.
    TicTacToe.Direction
    Represents which direction to move starting from a grid on the board.
    TicTacToe.Status
    Status of the game for each client.
    TicTacToeTUI
    A TicTacToe game with a TUI.
    TUI
    Utility class for static methods that use ANSI escape sequences to create a TUI.
    TUI.Color
    ANSI escape codes for colors.
    TUI.Color.Background
    Background colors.
    TUI.Color.Foreground
    Foreground colors
